required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence of Cystitis in Women Consuming a Mixture of Cranberry, Cinnamon, Probiotics
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study Evaluating the Number of Symptomatic Cystitis-like Episodes and Urinary Comfort of Women Consuming Cranberry, Cinnamon and Probiotic Strain Extracts

brief_summary.textblock:
Cranberries are traditionally used for urinary comfort and prevention of urinary disorders of bacterial origin and despite an EFSA opinion invalidating the clinical efficacy of cranberries, its mechanism of action has been several times proposed by the scientific community: it would act by inhibiting the synthesis of P-fimbriae leading to a complete disappearance of these adhesins, and to bacterial-type deformation by lengthening of the cell body. Cinnamon and microbiotic strains could enhance this synergy.
This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of a food supplement based on cranberry, cinnamon and microbiotic strains (Feminabiane CBU) on the symptoms of cystitis, urinary discomfort and the number of cystitis reported by women.

detailed_description.textblock: Women who use or not the cranberry, cinnamon, and microbiotic blend are encouraged to complete a 6-month diary in which they report any urinary tract disorders they encounter.

primary_outcome.description: Number of symptomatic cystitis-like episodes reported by the subject self-assessed using the "typical" domain of the Acute Cystitis Symptom Score (ACCS) and defined by a score ranged between 6 to 18.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the quality of life related to urinary discomfort
secondary_outcome.description: ACCS "Quality of life" domain ranged between 0 (better) and 9 (worse)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every day during each urinary symptoms (Week 0 to Week 24)
secondary_outcome.description: Global ACCS score ranged between 0 (better) and 39 (worse)
Measurement of the time interval between 2 antibiotic therapies if applicable

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean time to onset of symptomatic episodes of the cystitis
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the time interval between 2 symptomatic episodes of the cystitis

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of blend consumption in preventing symptomatic episode of cystitis
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the rate of women blend users versus non-users who did not reported any symptomatic episode of cystitis as defined by a 0 score for the "typical" domain of the Acute Cystitis Symptom Score (ACCS).

other_outcome.measure: Assessing the remanent effect of the mix on total urinary tract disorders
other_outcome.description: Total number of urinary tract disorders reported by women, compared to the 0-24 week period

other_outcome.measure: Assessing the remanent effect of the mix on the type urinary tract disorders
other_outcome.description: Rates of urinary tract disorders (cystitis and cystitis-like symptoms) reported by women, compared to the 0-24 week period

Mean statisfaction score using a 5-point Likert scale: 1 means worse satisfaction and 5 means the best satisfaction. Very satisfied=1, Somewhat satisfied=2, Neither satisfied nor dissatisfied=3, Somewhat dissatisfied=4 and Very dissatisfied=5
Weekly number of food supplements not ingested in relation to the expected consumption
Visual analogic score assessing abdominal pain (0= no pain, 10= worse pain)
Visual analogic score assessing bloating or flatulence (0= never, 10= always)

other_outcome.measure: Assessing tolerance to the ingestion of food supplements
other_outcome.description: Total number encountered of adverse events (abdominal pain, bloating, constipation) and rates of this adverse events

arm_group.description: Group of consumers of Feminabiane CBU : 2 tablets of Feminabiane CBU® every day, to be swallowed with a glass of water.
Control group of non consumers of Feminabiane CBU

intervention.description: EXTRACTS OF CRANBERRY, CINNAMON AND MICROBIOTIC STRAINS

study_pop.textblock: The first 80 women of the CEN Nutriment (Clinical Investigation Center) volunteer panel corresponding to the selection criteria and wishing to participate in the study.
